00001 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00002 /// @file         SPuzzleTrace.h
00003 ///
00004 /// @author       Ray Myers
00005 ///
00006 /// @compiler     Windows: MinGW / Linux: GNU G++
00007 ///
00008 /// @project      GNAT
00009 ///
00010 /// @description  This file contains the declaration of the CPuzzleTrace class
00011 ///               and the classes it uses.
00012 ///
00013 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00014 #ifndef _CPUZZLETRACE_H_
00015 #define _CPUZZLETRACE_H_
00016 
00017 #include <QList>
00018 #include <QString>
00019 #include <QStringList>
00020 #include <QSize>
00021 
00022 struct SPuzzleCall;
00023 struct IPuzzleLine;
00024 
00025 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00026 /// STreeTrace
00027 ///
00028 /// @description  The STreeTrace struct is the data structure used to represent
00029 ///               the trace of a tree. While traces are usually displayed in a
00030 ///               two dimensional grid that is now how the data is stored. The
00031 ///               grid is a representation of a depth first search of a tree of
00032 ///               calls, and thus the data for the trace is stored in just such
00033 ///               a tree.
00034 ///               The STreeTrace has attributes to store the data created from a
00035 ///               trace. It stores the name of the tracer as well as its column
00036 ///               headings. The other attribute is a list of calls that
00037 ///               represent the different depths used in an Iterative-Deepening
00038 ///               (ID) trace. If the trace is not ID then there will only be one
00039 ///               entry in the list.
00040 ///
00041 /// @limitations  This is a struct. It is meant as a way of combining data, but
00042 ///               it provides no encapsulation or data hiding. This has definite
00043 ///               speed benefits but sacrifices most forms of error checking.
00044 ///
00045 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00046 struct SPuzzleTrace
00047 {
00048     SPuzzleTrace();
00049     ~SPuzzleTrace();
00050 
00051     //This variable is the name of the tracer algorithm that created this trace.
00052     QString             s_aiName;
00053 
00054     //This variable is a list of the names or headers for each column. It is
00055     //often used to get a count() of how many columns there are in the trace.
00056     QStringList         s_columnNames;
00057 
00058     //This variable represent the different depths used in an
00059     //Iterative-Deepening(ID) trace. If the trace is not ID then there will only
00060     //be one entry in the list.
00061     QList<SPuzzleCall *>  s_depths;
00062 };
00063 
00064 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00065 /// SPuzzleCall
00066 ///
00067 /// @description  The SPuzzleCall class represents a call in the algorithm. The
00068 ///               calls themselves form a tree, and the grid that is a displayed
00069 ///               trace is a depth first search representation of this grid.
00070 ///               The STreeCall has two lists. The first list are it's children
00071 ///               in the tree of calls. The second list is the lines that makup
00072 ///               the call. It also holds a float representation of the return
00073 ///               value from the call.
00074 ///
00075 /// @limitations  This is a struct. It is meant as a way of combining data, but
00076 ///               it provides no encapsulation or data hiding. This has definite
00077 ///               speed benefits but sacrifices most forms of error checking.
00078 ///
00079 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00080 struct SPuzzleCall
00081 {
00082     SPuzzleCall();
00083     ~SPuzzleCall();
00084 
00085     //QList<SPuzzleCall *>  s_children;
00086 
00087     QList<IPuzzleLine *>  s_lines;
00088     float               s_returnValue;
00089 
00090     IPuzzleLine *operator[](int index);
00091 
00092     QString s_comment;
00093 };
00094 
00095 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00096 /// IPuzzleLine
00097 ///
00098 /// @description  The ITreeLine represents an actual line in a trace grid. The
00099 ///               different cells are returned as QStrings through the []
00100 ///               operator or they can be extracted as a list by the
00101 ///               toStringList function.
00102 ///
00103 /// @limitations  This is an Interface style structure. It is not meant to be,
00104 ///               and can not be instantiated. All subclasses must have the []
00105 ///               operator and toStringList overridden.
00106 ///
00107 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00108 struct IPuzzleLine
00109 {
00110     virtual ~IPuzzleLine();
00111     virtual QString operator[](int index) = 0;
00112     virtual QStringList toStringList() = 0;
00113 
00114 
00115 };
00116 
00117 #endif /*_STREETRACE_H_*/
